p: The standard AOAC Method 996:06 (2001) was adopted for extraction of sample for fatty acids analysis, followed by their methylation to fatty acid methyl esters (FAMEs) using methanolic boron trifluoride (BF 3) as an acid catalyst. FAMEs were measured quantitatively by a Gas Chromatograph, GC-FID (Agilent 6890 N, Agilent technologies, Santa Clara, California, USA). A DB-23 column (30 m × 0.25 mm i. d., 0.25μm, Agilent Technologies, Santa Clara, USA) containing 23% methylpolysiloxane was used as stationary phase for fatty acid analysis. Nitrogen was used as a carrier gas.
